roleset.name: being the cause of something

example.name: just arg0
example.text: An official for the lead underwriter declined to comment on the reason for the delay , but market participants speculated that a number of factors , including a lack of investor interest , were responsible .

propbank.arg: a number of factors , including a lack of investor interest

example.name: Both args
example.text: Cleveland mayor apologizes for claiming Tamir Rice was responsible for his own death .

example.name: Light Verb Construction
example.text: No one has taken responsibility for the murder .

roleset.note: RESPONSIBLE-J NOTES: This roleset applies to usages where the arg0 has caused something, factual usages. Updated by Claire (April 2015). Added by Julia based on WSJ data. (from responsible.01-j)

roleset.name: character trait, worthy of trust

role.descr: entity/act characterized as worthy or inspiring of trust

example.name: Responsible entity only
example.text: To be a parent , you must be responsible .

example.name: Responsible entity with reason for perception, concatenated
example.text: It was responsible of him to help the old lady across the street .

propbank.arg: of him to help the old lady across the street

example.name: Variant expressed as for-phrase
example.text: It was responsible for him to help the old lady across the street .

propbank.arg: for him to help the old lady across the street

example.name: with CXN
example.text: I 'm not responsible enough to have a pet ,

example.name: Noun responsibility
example.text: He is known for his responsibility .

example.name: Noun responsibleness
example.text: He was n't exactly known for his responsibleness .

roleset.note: RESPONSIBLE-J NOTES: For usages that do not highlight causation, nor an ongoing role/responsibility, instead a general character trait. Updated by Claire (April 2015). Added by Julia based on WordNet. This frame may require concatenation to capture hte entire action in Arg1; see examples. (from responsible.02-j) AMR NOTE: This is the ONLY counterpart to "irresponsible;" use this roleset with negative polarity.

roleset.name: Having a particular role where one is trusted with a duty

example.name: Args 0 and 1
example.text: She is responsible for sanitizing the data .

example.name: Args 0 and 2
example.text: He is responsible to the committee .

example.name: Noun Responsibility, drop empty it
example.text: It is my daughter 's responsibility to empty the dishwasher , but I always have to ask her ten times .

roleset.note: RESPONSIBLE-J NOTES: For usages that highlight a possibly generic, ongoing responsibility or duty. Updated by Claire (April 2015). Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from responsible.02-j)
